snippet: In Georgia, where nearly half of the nation’s peanuts are grown, the annual fall harvest has yielded a record crop that farmers say tastes better than average.
abstract: Georgia's annual fall peanut harvest, where nearly half of the nation’s peanuts are grown, has yielded record crop that farmers say tastes better than average; crop means prices should start falling as year ends; national peanut crop report forecasts more than 6.1 billion pounds for 2012, compared with 3.6 billion in 2011.
lead_paragraph: In Georgia, where nearly half of the nation’s peanuts are grown, the annual fall harvest has yielded a record crop that farmers say tastes better than average.

headline.main: In the South, a Good Year for Farmers of Peanuts
headline.print_headline: In the South, A Good Year For Farmers Of Peanuts
